intro: Boehmeria tenuistachys, commonly known as Chinese hemp or cloud silk, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is a member of the nettle family (Urticaceae) and is characterized by its soft, fibrous leaves and slender, branching stems. The plant is known for its high-quality fibers, which are used in the production of textiles and paper. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forests and along riverbanks. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a smooth, velvety texture.
